intro: Tretorhiza cruciata subsp. phlogifolia, commonly known as the fireweed or phlogifole, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, characterized by its distinctive leaf shapes and flowering structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cold climates. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in early summer. The subspecies is notable for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions and its role in ecological succession in disturbed habitats.
